projects.title: Marketing Attribution & Multi-Channel ROI Optimization
projects.problem: A B2B SaaS company investing $3M+ annually across 5+ channels lacked clear attribution, making budget allocation guesswork. Marketing wanted to prove ROI, while sales questioned lead quality. The goal was to build a data-driven attribution model to quantify true ROI and optimize spend.
insights: Data-driven attribution revealed Paid Search was over-credited by 80% under last-click models, while Organic/Content was undervalued.
Organic has highest true ROI (8.0 = $8 revenue per $1 spent), Email 4.0, SMS 3.2, Paid 2.1, Display 1.2.
SMS had the fastest payback (2.3 months) and highest LTV but received only 10% of budget.
Recommended shifting $400K from Paid to Organic/Email, projected to generate $360K incremental revenue (+3%).

charts.title: Channel ROI Heatmap (Return on Ad Spend)

projects.title: GTM Pipeline Diagnostics & Conversion Optimization
projects.problem: A B2B SaaS company generated significant MQLs but faced declining conversion rates (28% → 16%). The goal was to diagnose pipeline leaks, identify highest-ROI segments, and recommend GTM strategy adjustments.
insights: Root cause: Pipeline composition shifted from high-converting sources (Partner, Enterprise) to low-converting (broad paid, SMB).
Identified 'Tech mid-market' segment as a hidden gem: 35% win rate, $85K ACV, but only 20% of MQL spend.
Partner referrals showed 40% win rate and 60% lower CAC → recommended doubling co-marketing budget.
Recommended stricter BANT criteria as 30% of early-stage opportunities lacked budget or authority.

charts.title: Win Rate (%) by Channel vs. CAC (USD)

projects.title: Multi-Store Inventory Optimization
projects.problem: A mid-to-large beauty retailer with multi-location stores and e-commerce faced severe inventory imbalance: bestsellers stocked out in high-traffic locations while excess inventory (40–60+ days-on-hand) piled up in low-volume stores. Portfolio turnover was 4.2× vs. industry benchmark of 5.5×+. The goal was to optimize allocation, reduce stockouts and excess, and improve capital efficiency.
insights: Root cause was fixed allocation strategy; implemented store-specific, seasonally-adjusted logic.
Identified 42 inter-store transfer opportunities with 4.2x ROI, moving 3,200 units to high-demand locations.
Clearance strategy for bottom 25% SKUs reduced excess inventory by 65% in 6 weeks.
Results: Turnover improved 4.2x → 5.5x (+31%), stockouts reduced by 62%, annual net benefit $725K.
